2021-10-01.name: Oktoberfest
2021-10-01.summary: At this big riverfront festival, there's food, music and carnival rides, plus the opening Torchlight Parade and the Maple Leaf Parade on Saturday morning.

2021-10-01.name: Apple Festival
2021-10-01.summary: It's the 60th year of this big festival on Lake Superior, which features  orchard tours, history  walks, an apple-peeling contest, live music and a big parade at 2 p.m.  Sunday.

2021-10-01.name: Oktoberfest
2021-10-01.summary: There's German music and food at this Amana Colonies village, plus contests that include the Eisenmann, or Iron Man, competition: Teams roll kegs, walk a balance beam with full steins of beer and saw logs. The parade is at 10 a.m. Saturday.

2021-10-01.name: Door County Lighthouse Festival
2021-10-01.summary: The Door County Maritime Museum sponsors tours by air, land and water to lighthouses on the peninsula, some of which can be visited only during festival weekends. Reserve as early as possible.

2021-10-01.name: Chain O' Lakes Blues Festival
2021-10-01.summary: Listen to the blues at the historic Indian Crossing Casino.

2021-10-01.name: CelebrAsian Asian Heritage Festival
2021-10-01.summary: This festival at Western Gateway Park features such activities as martial arts, lion dancers,  chopstick races, a fashion show and, of course, food.

2021-10-02.name: Oktoberfest
2021-10-02.summary: At this big riverfront festival, there's food, music and carnival rides, plus the opening Torchlight Parade and the Maple Leaf Parade on Saturday morning.

2021-10-02.name: Apple Festival
2021-10-02.summary: It's the 60th year of this big festival on Lake Superior, which features  orchard tours, history  walks, an apple-peeling contest, live music and a big parade at 2 p.m.  Sunday.

2021-10-02.name: Oktoberfest
2021-10-02.summary: There's German music and food at this Amana Colonies village, plus contests that include the Eisenmann, or Iron Man, competition: Teams roll kegs, walk a balance beam with full steins of beer and saw logs. The parade is at 10 a.m. Saturday.

2021-10-02.name: Door County Lighthouse Festival
2021-10-02.summary: The Door County Maritime Museum sponsors tours by air, land and water to lighthouses on the peninsula, some of which can be visited only during festival weekends. Reserve as early as possible.

2021-10-02.name: Big Island Rendezvous and Festival
2021-10-02.summary: This southern Minnesota festival is great for families, with a voyageur encampment of more than 1,000 reenactors dancing, demonstrating, competing and pulling visitors back into the fur-trade era.

2021-10-02.name: Oktoberfest
2021-10-02.summary: This festival just north of Milwaukee features music and food plus             goofy contests: best lederhosen/dirndl, sauerkraut-eating, a German spelling bee and a live Glockenspiel show.

2021-10-02.name: Giant Pumpkin Fest
2021-10-02.summary: This town near Wisconsin Rapids calls itself the Giant Pumpkin Capital of Wisconsin and features a pumpkin-pie eating contest, pumpkin rolling and carving, a carnival and craft show.

2021-10-02.name: Autumn on Parade
2021-10-02.summary: Strolling performers appear at the Autumn on Parade Festival, and the Harvest Time Parade is on Sunday.

2021-10-02.name: Fall Village Market
2021-10-02.summary: This town west of Madison offers vintage and handmade goods, live music and food trucks.

2021-10-02.name: Rivertown Fall Art  Festival
2021-10-02.summary: This juried arts festival along the banks of the St. Croix River includes music and food vendors.

2021-10-02.name: Cranberry Fest
2021-10-02.summary: In this northeast Wisconsin lakes town, there will be marsh tours, music, a cranberry beer and wine garden, an antiques market, fiber-art show and crafts fair.

2021-10-02.name: Chain O' Lakes Blues Festival
2021-10-02.summary: Listen to the blues at the historic Indian Crossing Casino.

2021-10-02.name: CelebrAsian Asian Heritage Festival
2021-10-02.summary: This festival at Western Gateway Park features such activities as martial arts, lion dancers,  chopstick races, a fashion show and, of course, food.

2021-10-02.name: Apple Affair
2021-10-02.summary: In the bluffs above Trempealeau, this festival features a 10-foot apple pie, a hunt for a Silver Apple, a race of floating wooden apples and a bicycle tour with a 20-mile route through apple orchards and hillier 35- and 60-mile routes.

2021-10-02.name: Northside Oktoberfest
2021-10-02.summary: The Iowa City Brewfest is part of this festival, which includes keg  bowling, beer sliding and nail-striking as well as traditional Oktoberfest music in an outdoor beer hall.

2021-10-02.name: Autumnfest
2021-10-02.summary: This town on the St. Croix River offers live music, a car show, food trucks and an arts and crafts fair in Overlook Park.

2021-10-03.name: Oktoberfest
2021-10-03.summary: At this big riverfront festival, there's food, music and carnival rides, plus the opening Torchlight Parade and the Maple Leaf Parade on Saturday morning.

2021-10-03.summary: This juried arts festival along the banks of the St. Croix River includes music and food vendors.

2021-10-03.name: Cranberry Fest
2021-10-03.summary: In this northeast Wisconsin lakes town, there will be marsh tours, music, a cranberry beer and wine garden, an antiques market, fiber-art show and crafts fair.

2021-10-13.name: Chicago International Film Festival
2021-10-13.summary: This year's program includes 65 films and nine programs of shorts that are screening at the ChiTown Movies Drive-In in Pilsen.

2021-10-14.name: Chicago International Film Festival
2021-10-14.summary: This year's program includes 65 films and nine programs of shorts that are screening at the ChiTown Movies Drive-In in Pilsen.

2021-10-15.name: Chicago International Film Festival
2021-10-15.summary: This year's program includes 65 films and nine programs of shorts that are screening at the ChiTown Movies Drive-In in Pilsen.

2021-10-15.name: Fall Festival
2021-10-15.summary: This Door County festival features pumpkin bowling, a derby race, chainsaw carving, a  pingpong-ball drop and a parade at 11 a.m. Saturday.

2021-10-15.name: Southwest Wisconsin Fall Art Tour
2021-10-15.summary: This popular studio tour includes artists at studios between Mineral Point, Spring Green, Dodgeville and Baraboo.

2021-10-16.name: Chicago International Film Festival

2021-10-16.name: Open House Chicago
2021-10-16.summary: The Chicago Architecture Foundation sponsors this free, behind-the-scenes peek at more than 200 mansions, clubs,  churches, hotels and theaters.

2021-10-16.name: Oktoberfest
2021-10-16.summary: This downtown festival near Lake Geneva features wine and beer tasting, music, a car show, arts and crafts and a chili cookoff.

2021-10-16.name: Jack O' Lantern Festival
2021-10-16.summary: There's a pumpkin-carving and scarecrow-making contests, kids' inflatables, pumpkin roll and, in the evening, a zombie run in the forest, bonfires and live music.

2021-10-16.name: Family Fall Fest
2021-10-16.summary: On the largest of the Apostle Islands, there will be a vintage-car show, cider- and soap-making, pumpkin decorating, a pie-eating contest, street vendors and a kids' costume parade.

2021-10-18.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2021-10-22.name: Moose Madness Festival
2021-10-22.summary: This Lake Superior town  offers a medallion hunt, scavenger hunt, sled-dog open house, games led by Murray the Moose and activities at North House Folk School.

2021-10-23.name: Chicago International Film Festival
2021-10-23.summary: This year's program includes 65 films and nine programs of shorts that are screening at the ChiTown Movies Drive-In in Pilsen.

2021-10-23.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2021-10-23.summary: This Lake Superior town  offers a medallion hunt, scavenger hunt, sled-dog open house, games led by Murray the Moose and activities at North House Folk School.

2021-10-23.name: Halloween
2021-10-23.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2021-10-23.name: Oktoberfest
2021-10-23.summary: Carlos Creek Winery's brewing partner, 22 Northmen, hosts this festival, which includes a stein-holding contest, pumpkin throwing, horse-drawn wagon rides and live bands.

2021-10-23.name: Pumpkin Chuckin Fest
2021-10-23.summary: The festival in this town, just west of Racine, features a pumpkin catapult contest, barbecue cook-off, pie auction, pumpkin-baking contest, children's games and music.

2021-10-23.name: Scarecrow Festival
2021-10-23.summary: This town in northwest Illinois offers scarecrow and doughnut-eating contests, pumpkin racing, a petting zoo and a band concert.

2021-10-24.name: Chicago International Film Festival
2021-10-24.summary: This year's program includes 65 films and nine programs of shorts that are screening at the ChiTown Movies Drive-In in Pilsen.

2021-10-24.name: Halloween
2021-10-24.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2021-10-24.name: Witches & Wizards of Woodstock
2021-10-24.summary: This all-ages fantasy festival in Woodstock Square features a magical talking hat, Quidditch training, an owlery, a wandering magician, a cosplay scavenger hunt and a costume parade and contest.

2021-10-25.name: Halloween
2021-10-25.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2021-10-26.name: Halloween
2021-10-26.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2021-10-27.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2021-10-29.name: Halloween
2021-10-29.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2021-10-29.name: Mystery at the Fur Post
2021-10-29.summary: Unmask the phantom stalking the big top during "The Circus Returns'' at the             re-created Snake River (formerly North West Company) Fur Post, an hour north of the Twin Cities. The program is family-friendly, and reservations are recommended.

2021-10-29.name: Halloween Parade & Festival
2021-10-29.summary: There will be a hot-air balloon glow Friday, kids' activities and the town's annual parade along Main Street at 6:30 p.m.

2021-10-29.name: Jack O'Lantern Days
2021-10-29.summary: There will be mask making, pumpkin carving, trick or treating and haunted trolley tours.

2021-10-29.name: Zombie Days
2021-10-29.summary: Zombies will take over this town on Chequamegon Bay, and there are also carved-pumpkin, costume and house-decorating contests, a ghost hunt and a drive-in movie.

2021-10-30.name: Halloween
2021-10-30.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2021-10-30.name: Mystery at the Fur Post
2021-10-30.summary: Unmask the phantom stalking the big top during "The Circus Returns'' at the             re-created Snake River (formerly North West Company) Fur Post, an hour north of the Twin Cities. The program is family-friendly, and reservations are recommended.

2021-10-30.name: Halloween Parade & Festival
2021-10-30.summary: There will be a hot-air balloon glow Friday, kids' activities and the town's annual parade along Main Street at 6:30 p.m.

2021-10-30.name: Jack O'Lantern Days
2021-10-30.summary: There will be mask making, pumpkin carving, trick or treating and haunted trolley tours.

2021-10-30.name: Zombie Days
2021-10-30.summary: Zombies will take over this town on Chequamegon Bay, and there are also carved-pumpkin, costume and house-decorating contests, a ghost hunt and a drive-in movie.

2021-10-30.name: UFO Day
2021-10-30.summary: There's a craft fair, kids' games and a Forbidden Forest, but the 1 p.m. parade is the main event in this riverside village just south of Madison, where residents reported more than a dozen UFO sightings in the winter of 1987.

2021-10-30.name: Arts in the Dark Halloween parade
2021-10-30.summary: Floats, giant puppets and performances are part of the 6-8 p.m. parade along State Street.

2021-10-30.name: BatFest
2021-10-30.summary: This Fox River town hosts a pumpkin roll, pumpkin-carving battles, "Thriller'' dances, marshmallow shooting and a parade.

2021-10-30.name: Mount Carroll Pumpkin Fest
2021-10-30.summary: In this northwest Illinois town, there will be a costume parade, pumpkin bowling, pumpkin slingshot and pumpkin street drag races.

2021-10-30.name: Day of the Dead Xicago
2021-10-30.summary: In the National Museum of Mexican Art and Harrison Park, families can create ofrendas (altars), eat pan de muerto, listen to musical performances and get faces painted. Admission is free.

2021-10-30.name: Day of the Dead
2021-10-30.summary: In Old Town Mankato along Riverfront Drive, there will be a mariachi band, Aztec and folklore dancers, a makers' market, food trucks and children's activities and treats.

2021-10-08.name: Scenic Drive Festival
2021-10-08.summary: In the southeast corner of Iowa, 11 villages feature quilt shows, scarecrow contests, bake sales, tours of             historic sites, wine tasting and street fairs.

2021-10-08.name: Northeast Iowa Artists' Studio Tour
2021-10-08.summary: Drive through bluff country to see 56 artists at             43 sites around Decorah, Burr Oak, St. Lucas, Waukon, West Union, Cresco, New Albin, Lansing, Elgin and Clermont.

2021-10-08.name: Scarecrow Festival
2021-10-08.summary: There's a big scarecrow contest plus a             carnival, music, dance and the Autumn on the Fox arts show in this town west of Chicago. New this year is the Family Zone.

2021-10-08.name: Pumpkin Festival
2021-10-08.summary: Every year, this northern suburb of Chicago tries to break the record for most lighted jack-o-lanterns. In addition to all-you-can-carve stations, there will be costume, pie-eating and carving contests.

2021-10-08.name: Apple Festival
2021-10-08.summary: In this Lake Michigan town, there's a pumpkin-carving contest, children's activities and an arts and crafts show.

2021-10-08.name: Covered Bridge Studio Tour
2021-10-08.summary: This studio tour in eastern Wisconsin includes more than 60 artists in Cedarburg, Grafton, Port Washington, Mequon, Thiensville and Newburg.

2021-10-09.name: Scenic Drive Festival
2021-10-09.summary: In the southeast corner of Iowa, 11 villages feature quilt shows, scarecrow contests, bake sales, tours of             historic sites, wine tasting and street fairs.

2021-10-09.name: Northeast Iowa Artists' Studio Tour
2021-10-09.summary: Drive through bluff country to see 56 artists at             43 sites around Decorah, Burr Oak, St. Lucas, Waukon, West Union, Cresco, New Albin, Lansing, Elgin and Clermont.

2021-10-09.name: Apple Festival
2021-10-09.summary: In this Lake Michigan town, there's a pumpkin-carving contest, children's activities and an arts and crafts show.

2021-10-09.name: Covered Bridge Studio Tour
2021-10-09.summary: This studio tour in eastern Wisconsin includes more than 60 artists in Cedarburg, Grafton, Port Washington, Mequon, Thiensville and Newburg.

2021-10-09.name: Madison County Covered Bridge Festival
2021-10-09.summary: John Wayne was born there, George Washington Carver lived there and the famous covered bridges still are there. The festival in this town southwest of Des Moines features guided bus tours to the bridges, free horse-drawn wagon rides to Wayne's house, Old West shootouts, live music and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2021-10-09.name: Civil War Immersion Weekend at Norskedalen
2021-10-09.summary: This pioneer farmstead in the coulees southeast of La Crosse is wonderfully atmospheric, and the crackerjack re-enactors of the Second Wisconsin Volunteer Infantry's Company B give the region's most affecting portrayal of war.

2021-10-09.name: Galena Country Fair
2021-10-09.summary: There's a juried fine arts/arts and crafts fair, farmers market, wine garden, bake shop, music and children's games in Grant Park.

2021-10-09.name: Pumpkin Patch Festival
2021-10-09.summary: There'll be music, children's games and arts and crafts in this Door County village.

2021-10-09.name: Oktoberfest
2021-10-09.summary: There will be music, food and free pumpkins on downtown streets.

2021-10-09.name: Burgoo Festival
2021-10-09.summary: The street party in this northern Illinois town, gateway to Starved Rock State Park, features vats of "pioneer'' stew, a crafts fair and music.

2021-10-09.name: Harvest Fest
2021-10-09.summary: In this river town, there will be a pumpkin pie-eating contest, a pumpkin regatta on the St. Croix, a microbrew tasting and a pedal tractor pull.

2021-10-09.name: Shadows of the Blue and Gray
2021-10-09.summary: This Civil War festival off I-80, half an hour west of Starved Rock  State Park, includes battle re-enactments both days.

2021-10-10.name: Scenic Drive Festival
2021-10-10.summary: In the southeast corner of Iowa, 11 villages feature quilt shows, scarecrow contests, bake sales, tours of             historic sites, wine tasting and street fairs.

2021-10-10.summary: This Civil War festival off I-80, half an hour west of Starved Rock  State Park, includes battle re-enactments both days.

2021-10-10.name: Harvest Fest
2021-10-10.summary: See old-time artisanry at the Swiss Historical Village, including sausage-stuffing and cheese-making in the 1890s cheese factory.

2021-10-31.name: Jack O'Lantern Days
2021-10-31.summary: There will be mask making, pumpkin carving, trick or treating and haunted trolley tours.

2021-10-31.name: Zombie Days
2021-10-31.summary: Zombies will take over this town on Chequamegon Bay, and there are also carved-pumpkin, costume and house-decorating contests, a ghost hunt and a drive-in movie.

2021-10-31.name: Halloween Outdoor Puppet Extravaganza
2021-10-31.summary: This year, the larger-than-life puppetry troupe will collaborate on The Cry of the Ancestors, a community pageant procession from Powderhorn Park, followed by concerts and cabaret. Free, with donations requested.
